page.title: 17Lyminge Forest
page.content: Lyminge Forest is a forest on the way to Canterbury. A few different woods make up Lyminge Forest. Most of the trees are fir trees. Lots of sponsored walks and nature trails are held there. In 1984 Lyminge School held a sponsored walk there. It is about 2\ miles away from Lyminge. The forest is joined on to Round Down Wood and Stowting Rough. There are several reservoirs in case of fire. There is lots of wild life in Lyminge Forest. There are quite a few deciduous trees. Fir trees have very long thin leaves that we call needles. They are coniferous and have pine cones on them. The animals in Lyminge Forest are rabbits, adders, badgers, foxes, and grey squirrels. Lyminge Forest is guarded by the Forestry Commission and has a road running by it.
